Constructors

Effect(GraphicsDevice, VertexLayoutDescription, byte[], byte[], SpecializationConstant[]?)

Initializes a new instance of the Effect class using shader bytecode.

public Effect(GraphicsDevice graphicsDevice, VertexLayoutDescription vertexLayout, byte[] vertBytes, byte[] fragBytes, SpecializationConstant[]? constants = null)

Parameters

graphicsDevice GraphicsDevice

The GraphicsDevice used for rendering.

vertexLayout VertexLayoutDescription

The VertexLayoutDescription defining the vertex structure.

vertBytes byte[]

The compiled bytecode for the vertex shader.

fragBytes byte[]

The compiled bytecode for the fragment shader.

constants SpecializationConstant[]

Optional specialization constants for shader customization.

Effect(GraphicsDevice, VertexLayoutDescription, string, string, SpecializationConstant[]?)

Initializes a new instance of the Effect class using shader file paths.

public Effect(GraphicsDevice graphicsDevice, VertexLayoutDescription vertexLayout, string vertPath, string fragPath, SpecializationConstant[]? constants = null)

Parameters

graphicsDevice GraphicsDevice

The GraphicsDevice used for rendering.

vertexLayout VertexLayoutDescription

The VertexLayoutDescription defining the vertex structure.

vertPath string

The path to the vertex shader file.

fragPath string

The path to the fragment shader file.

constants SpecializationConstant[]

Optional specialization constants for shader customization.

Methods

AddBufferLayout(string, uint, SimpleBufferType, ShaderStages)

Adds a new buffer layout to the effect with the specified parameters.

public void AddBufferLayout(string name, uint slot, SimpleBufferType bufferType, ShaderStages stages)

Parameters

name string

The name of the buffer layout to add. Must be unique within the effect.

slot uint

The slot index at which the buffer layout will be bound.

bufferType SimpleBufferType

The type of buffer being added, defined by the SimpleBufferType enum.

stages ShaderStages

The shader stages where the buffer will be accessible, specified by ShaderStages.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if a buffer layout with the specified name already exists.

AddTextureLayout(string, uint)

Adds a new texture layout to the effect with the specified parameters.

public void AddTextureLayout(string name, uint slot)

Parameters

name string

The unique name of the texture layout to add.

slot uint

The slot index where the texture layout will be bound.

Exceptions

InvalidOperationException

Thrown if a texture layout with the same name already exists.

Apply(CommandList, Material?)

Apply the state effect immediately before rendering it.

public virtual void Apply(CommandList commandList, Material? material = null)

Parameters

commandList CommandList
material Material

Dispose(bool)

Disposes of the object and releases associated resources.

protected override void Dispose(bool disposing)

Parameters

disposing bool

True if called from user code; false if called from a finalizer.

GetBufferLayout(string)

Retrieves the buffer layout identified by the specified name.

public SimpleBufferLayout GetBufferLayout(string name)

Parameters

name string

The name of the buffer layout to retrieve.

Returns

SimpleBufferLayout

The SimpleBufferLayout matching the specified name.

Exceptions

KeyNotFoundException

Thrown if no buffer layout with the specified name is found.

GetBufferLayoutSlot(string)

Retrieves the slot index of a buffer layout by its name.

public uint GetBufferLayoutSlot(string name)

Parameters

name string

The name of the buffer layout whose slot index is to be retrieved.

Returns

uint

The slot index of the specified buffer layout.

Exceptions

KeyNotFoundException

Thrown when the buffer layout with the specified name does not exist.

GetBufferLayouts()

Retrieves a collection of buffer layouts associated with the effect.

public IReadOnlyCollection<SimpleBufferLayout> GetBufferLayouts()

Returns

IReadOnlyCollection<SimpleBufferLayout>

A read-only collection of SimpleBufferLayout objects representing the buffer layouts.

GetPipeline(SimplePipelineDescription)

Retrieves or creates a pipeline for the given pipeline description.

public SimplePipeline GetPipeline(SimplePipelineDescription pipelineDescription)

Parameters

pipelineDescription SimplePipelineDescription

The description of the pipeline to retrieve or create.

Returns

SimplePipeline

A SimplePipeline configured with the specified description.

GetTextureLayout(string)

Retrieves a texture layout by its name from the list of available texture layouts.

public SimpleTextureLayout GetTextureLayout(string name)

Parameters

name string

The name of the texture layout to retrieve.

Returns

SimpleTextureLayout

The SimpleTextureLayout matching the specified name.

Exceptions

KeyNotFoundException

Thrown if no texture layout with the specified name is found.

GetTextureLayoutSlot(string)

Retrieves the texture slot index for the specified texture name in the effect's texture layouts.

public uint GetTextureLayoutSlot(string name)

Parameters

name string

The name of the texture whose slot index is to be retrieved.

Returns

uint

The zero-based index of the texture slot corresponding to the specified texture name.

Exceptions

KeyNotFoundException

Thrown when the specified texture name does not exist in the texture layouts.

GetTextureLayouts()

Retrieves a collection of texture layouts associated with the effect.

public IReadOnlyCollection<SimpleTextureLayout> GetTextureLayouts()

Returns

IReadOnlyCollection<SimpleTextureLayout>

A read-only collection of SimpleTextureLayout objects representing the texture layouts.

Parameters

path string

The file path to the shader source code.

Returns

byte[]

A byte array containing the bytecode from the shader file.
